name: The Swan Hotel

reviews.title: Gorgeous cottage hideaway with the benefits of the hotel
reviews.text: We have just returned from a stay at the Swan Hotel for our "mini" honeymoon, and we had an amazing time.

reviews.title: 10th Anniversary Jaunt
reviews.text: Whilst looking for the break we wanted to find somewhere we could get away, with the benefits of a hotel but something more than just a room. We chose the Swan hotel as it looked lovely and picturesque and the cottages they offered looked spot on for our requirements. We booked to stay 3 nights in the Whooper Cottage and it was perfect in every way. Tucked at the end of a row of cottages owned by the hotel situated at the side of the main building, it was quiet and secluded. Entrance to the cottage is through a gate and a fair sized garden including a covered hot tub which was just brilliant, even on a cold wet March evening, it was lovely to chill out in and drink champagne.

reviews.title: Wonderful birthday break!
reviews.text: The cottage itself is lovely and much bigger than I expected, it has a large hallway, fair sized living room with sofa, large flat screen TV, DVD player and iPod player and double doors to the patio - which has table chairs and a heat lamp which we unfortunately didn't get to use because of the rain. The stairs wind upwards into a large bedroom with huge comfy bed and another huge TV. The bathroom is also really large with bath, double sinks and seperate toilet (there is a stand alone shower in a small room off the hallway downstairs) Everything was lovingly decorated and clean and there were plenty of towels and robes. There is a lovely added touch of full size Molton Brown products and not the usual travel sizes which you get in a lot of places. We felt that this added to the special feel of the place and it really was lovely and cosy and homely.

reviews.title: OUTSTANDING
reviews.text: The hotel itself is also very nice. We ate in the restaurant on the first night. The staff were very attentive and whilst the meal wasn't cheap, it's what you would expect to pay in a decent hotel and the restaurant had a lovely atmosphere and the food was very nice. Similarly we also ate in the bar the last night and again food and service were great. As we were in the cottage we got our breakfast delivered to our room every morning which was a nice touch and meant we could lounge around a bit more. There is a really homely and cosy feel to the whole place and I would definitely recommend the Swan Hotel.

reviews.title: The perfect festive break
reviews.text: As for Bibury itself, it is lovey and picturesque but there really isn't much around (especially if it's raining and you don't want to walk far) so you are restricted to the hotel for food etc really if you don't want to drive anywhere. We visited Bourton on the Water and Burford which are both within around 20 mins drive and both are very lovely with more choice of places to eat.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: My wife and I had a fantastic stay in this hotel. Everything about it was perfect - the setting, our room (Mandarin), the food and the service. It is one of the best hotel's we have stayed in and would definitely come back again. There was a very relaxed atmosphere in the hotel which made it have that home from home feel.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with one sour note £6.99 to use wifi!!!
reviews.text: Beautiful building in a beautiful village setting, ducks quacking make this a super choice of hotel. Good food and helpful staff.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Stayed three nights and was mostly very pleased with service and food. Breakfast was top notch, great choice and quality. Staff helpful.

reviews.title: AVOID AVOID AVOID!!
reviews.text: Couldn't use my mobile, no signal and then the big shock, to use the hotel wi-fi the cost was £6.99 for 90 minutes. Total rip off.

reviews.title: Not worth it.
reviews.text: One night dinner was not good in the bar, very slow because it was busy in the restaurant and my steak was tough. Otherwise all good. I liked the staff and the room was small but all was good quality, great bathroom too.

reviews.title: Picture postcard perfect
reviews.text: After much research on the net I chose to stay at The Swan Hotel in Bibury and could not have been more thrilled with the result. The village of Bibury is the most beautiful village in the Cotswolds with the extremely photogenic Arlington Row just down the road. The Swan Hotel was magnificent-beautiful rooms and fantastic service. So romantic and a photographers dream-do not miss this wonderful opportunity!

reviews.title: lovely hotel
reviews.text: Positives - The staff really are brilliant, every single one of them was helpful, friendly and efficient. We paid extra for a superior room which was spacious and decorated nicely. They provide tea, coffee, hot chocolate and biscuits plus real milk if you ring down to reception delivered to your room which makes a real difference to the usual UHT milk. The bathroom was really spacious and the hotel provide Molton Brown toiletries. We ate in the restaurant on the first night which was pretty good, not worth paying £32 for though but it was part of our package. On the second night we ate in the bar and we actually thought the food was better here. The breakfast is really good, lovely bacon and sausages or trout and scrambled egg if you fancy it - served until 10am at weekends.

reviews.title: Wedding venue of my dreams
reviews.text: Negatives - the garden is nice but they had some bare flower beds which seemed odd for June plus there was really limited seating, we ended up sitting on the edge of the river, feet dangling down as we drank some beers from the trout farm shop (cheaper than the hotel bar) Parking is a bit limited due to the number of tourists visiting the village, they have mostly left by 5pm though. They charge £6 hour for wii fi - not what I would expect now as so many hotels provide this for free

reviews.title: Couldn't Fault It
reviews.text: Overall a really nice hotel and I would want to stay again

reviews.title: Wonderful stay. Very special.
reviews.text: I got married here on 27th June. It is simply stunning. The hotel staff are friendly and professional and everyone commented on how beautiful the gardens and hotel was. I cannot rate this hotel high enough, not just because we got married here but because it is a fabulous hotel!

reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
reviews.text: Having married at The Swan we decided to have an anniversary celebration in Room 11 which is the premier room in the hotel. Upon arrival we found the staff extremely helpful and accommodating. We had a champagne and strawberry cream tea included in our package which was lovely. The 3 course dinner was exceptionally good and the waiting staff attentive throughout.

reviews.title: great especially if you get promotional rates
reviews.text: There was unfortunately one big downside to our stay – the cleanliness and serviceability of the bathroom (which had been recently highlighted by Clover51 here- I don’t know if they complained to the hotel management). This bathroom has a 2 person Jacuzzi bath and a double size shower. There were watermark stains on the bath from 2 of the nozzles. Nearly all the chrome rings around the nozzles were split. The nozzles were grubby. There were 2 huge cobwebs laden in dust over the shower cubicle. The water runoff in the shower cubicle door was filthy. One tile between the bath and the shelf at the end of the bathroom was broken with pieces missing. A chair in the corner of the room was so dusty that I was able to leave a clearly defined mark in the dust.

reviews.title: Worst Nights Sleep of My Life!
reviews.text: I spoke with the young lady duty manager and expressed my concerns at the state of the bathroom. She came and inspected the bathroom and readily agreed that it was well below standard, especially being the honeymoon suite. Having called upon the Head Housekeeper to join her she then found further faults with the bathroom - a broken and jagged tile in the bottom of the shower cubicle and chipped grubby paintwork below the shower door.) She decided that the handyman needed to be involved and the room closed for letting for 2 days whilst repairs and a thorough cleaning were carried out.

reviews.title: Liked the lunch!
reviews.text: The complaint was handled very well and the cost of our stay was discounted to my satisfaction to make up for the disappointment.

reviews.title: Desperate lunch experience
reviews.text: I sincerely hope that some lessons have been learnt as it is a lovely place to stay.

description: History surrounds you at The Swan Hotel, located in the picturesque village of Bibury, described as the 'prettiest village in England' by William Morris. The Hotel offers you a relaxing stay in comfortable surroundings, featuring cosy lounges, roaring log fires, antique furnishing and rich decor. Our dining room is home to great English cusine and a fine wine selection. In our Bar and Cafe Swan meals are served all day.The tranquil Swan Gardens offer residents the delights of the outdoors.
